channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Bill Gates Is Geeking Out Over This New Power Plant
item.description: Bill Gates digs geothermal energy, and he visited a planned facility in Cape Station, Utah. Here’s why.

item.title: There’s No Such Thing as Too Many LinkedIn Posts, Says a New Analysis of 2 Million of Them
item.description: Yes, LinkedIn has an AI slop problem, but if you’re looking to build a following on the platform, more is still more.

item.title: The Jobs Market Is So Bad That Every Wall Street Firm Now Expects Multiple Rate Cuts in 2025
item.description: Bank of America was the final rate-cut holdout.

item.title: Ken Griffin lays down the law on why Trump needs to back off the Fed, saying his meddling could prompt a national debt crisis
item.description: Ken Griffin warns Trump’s pressure on Jerome Powell and the Federal Reserve risks eroding U.S. institutional credibility.

item.title: Why CEOs Should Care About the Eroding Middle Class
item.description: 3 illuminating recent stories show the struggles of middle-class U.S. workers and consumers may intensify.

item.title: Does SAP disprove the rule that Europe can’t scale tech companies?

item.title: Dow futures rise as recession fears grow while Wall Street awaits the one thing that could derail Fed rate cuts
item.description: On Thursday, the consumer price index is due, and Wall Street sees a 0.3% gain, accelerating from the 0.2% pace a month earlier.
